sub_title: VP Standard Software at Q-Free ASA
summary:
I'm an experienced manager of software development groups in an international environment. Since my teams work from different international locations, I have developed good strategies for managing remote and hybrid work environments. Due to my master's degree in computer science and more than 16 years of experience working as an engineer, I have a strong technical background. My engineering experience, technical knowledge, together with my communication skills, enthusiasm and experience with working in a dynamic international setting with cultural differences and people with different backgrounds, help me in building and managing my teams in an optimal way, where I always have the goal to make persons excel and feel confident in their strengths. 
My technical account management experience, product management experience, engineering experience and my more than 6 years of experience in being part of a management organization, added to my skill to be able to translate corporate strategy to development and also vice versa, translating development and trends in technology to corporate strategy.

certifications.name: Timemanagement
certifications.authority: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

profile_positions.location: Groningen Area, Netherlands and Oslo, Norway
profile_positions.description:
As vice president of the Standard Software group, I'm leading the Standard Software Group in Q-Free.

As VP examples of my responsibilities are managing the software development, HR including hiring processes, resource and budget management, developing short, middle and long-term vision for product development and managing of and contributing to tender and sales processes. In the role of product manager, I work closely together with the product owners in my team to define functionality and features. 

As vice president of the Standard Software Group, I'm part of the Tolling division management organization. In the tolling division management organization, I define together with Vice Presidents of other departments the division's strategy, offerings and product portfolio.  

The Standard Software Group is a team that builds (cloud) solutions for processing, analyzing and visualizing of data from traffic sensors in Toll systems and Smart City solutions. The development team is a multi-national team with database, front-end and back-end engineers based in Norway (Oslo and Trondheim), Portugal and Slovenia.   

In the team we use a diverse set of platforms and technologies for both cloud and on-premises solutions. For example, microservices, containerization (Docker), different types of databases, message queues, rpc, caching, and multiple programming languages for front- and back-end development.

The team uses agile development processes.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Standard Software

profile_positions.description: As project manager in the Tolling Back Office group of Q-Free I'm the project manager of the development project for a nation wide Truck Tolling project. As project manager I'm responsible for communication with the consortium and the customer. In this role I translate the wishes of the customer to development and manage the software development team of Q-Free. The software development team is an international team with development divisions in Slovenia and Norway (Trondheim and Oslo)
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Tolling Back Office

profile_positions.location: Groningen Area, Netherlands and Oslo, Norway
profile_positions.description:
As Product Manager for the Global Platforms group I lead the development group where Q-Free develops an Azure cloud solution for gathering, analyzing and visualizing traffic sensor data for Smart City applications and solutions.  

As product manager for the Global Platforms group I have the responsibility for gathering, reworking and prioritizing requirements coming from the market units and any domain specific implementation that we are doing at the time. In this role, I’m also the product owner of the Azure cloud solution (Q-Free Hub) and as product owner I’m responsible for deciding which features for the Hub and domain specific Portal applications are prioritized. Preparing sprint and managing sprint progress in an Agile development process is part of this. Also keeping the short-, mid- and long term roadmap for the Global Platforms group up to data is the product manager's responsibility. 

Prioritization of features is based on analysis of business cases and technical implications. The return of investment analysis is done in close collaboration with the product owner and/or manager of the domain the feature resulted from. The technical implications are determined in close collaboration with the engineers of the global platforms group.

As product manager of the Global Platforms group I'm part of the CTO management group and report to the CTO of Q-Free.
profile_positions.title: Product Manager Global Platforms

profile_positions.description: As Product Manager for the Service Line Parking I'm responsible for the offering portfolio and roadmap within the parking area, manage products, systems and services, offer support to sales processes and provide training to the sales force and other parts of the organization.
profile_positions.title: Global Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Sales and technical support and management for the integration of Q-Free's License Plate Recognition systems at national and international customers
- Project management for the development and integration of an Intelligent Transportation System. The project group consisted out of persons from different international offices of Q-Free. 
- Responsible for keeping up to date with technical knowledge and maintaining contacts with suppliers in traffic management technology, specifically traffic cameras.
profile_positions.title: Technical Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Internal manager for the Panorama project. Panorama is an European research project in the field of image processing
- Project Manager for the Software Development Imaging Group (2010-2011) 
- Development of the single gantry free flow tolling solution of Q-Free. Specifically the development of the cameras and image processing software for tracking a vehicle passing the gantry and reading the vehicle's license plate
- Research and Development for the license plate recognition software of Q-Free
profile_positions.title: Senior engineer Video and ALPR

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for technical sales support from pre-sales to supporting and managing projects at national and international customers.
- As Senior engineer doing research and development for Dacolian's license plate recognition software and systems. 
- Responsible for keeping up to date on technical knowledge on traffic cameras and maintaining contact with the suppliers and manufactures of traffic cameras.
profile_positions.title: Technical Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
-Research and Development of innovative new technologies and algorithms in the field of automated license plate recognition and other intelligent traffic systems.
-Supervision of graduation students at Dacolian.
-Research and Development of computer vision systems for industrial purposes.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer and Scientific IT-Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Student assistent at the department of Math and Computer Science at the University of Groningen at diverse courses in
- Software design and engineering
- Databases
- Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: With 1400 members GLTB is the biggest tennisclub of the Northern Part of the Netherlands. As chairman of the board I'm responsible for leading the board, set up regular meetings, be a spokesman for the club and work together with other people in the board and other committees on improving and maintaining the tennis facilities and club activities.

Noorderlicht is a drama club playing farces. As chairman of the club I was responsible for leading meetings of the board and as board member making necessary arrangements for the club. Besides being the chairman I also played several roles in several plays we performed during the years.
Stichting de Zijlen organizes summer camps for mentally and physically disabled children. I was one of the volunteer camp leaders during the summer holiday.

During my student period I have been secretary and chairman of the Math and Computer Science department student committee Axioma of the Rijksuniversiteit Groningen. I have also been a member and chairman of the committee for  introducing new students at the Math and Computer Science department of the Rijksuniversiteit Groningen.
